newsitem.title: USA: Novell to flatten management structure.
newsitem.headline: Novell to flatten management structure.

text.p: Novell Inc President and Chief Operating Officer Joe Marengi said on Thursday a 12-person management team will be responsible for decisions at the software company in order to better present a "single face to the customer" and flatten the management team.

He also told a teleconfernce call that the announced departure on Thursday of executive vice president and general manager of Novell Products Group, Steve Markman "had been looked at for a while." Markham left after nine months with Novell, which has seeng several top executives depart in recent months.
Marengi, who defended the new structure, said the group will be able to make decisions with the kind of speed needed in today's market.
Marengi became president when Chief Executive Officer Bob Frankenberg resigned in late August.
Marengi said he recently met five chief information officers from "major companies" in Europe whom he said are committed to Novell's Netware 4.0 product.
Marengi did not identify the chief information officers or the companies during the conference call.
Novell has been beset with problems and its stock price has been languishing around the $10 level. Shares closed trading today at 10-5/8, off 5/8 in exchange trading.
The company is searching for a chief executive and that goal is still on course, Marengi told reporters.
Among those reporting to Marengi will be Mary Burnside, executive vice president for corporate services, chief technology officer Glenn Ricart and Jim Tolonen, chief financial officer.
